title: Drawing, "Decorative Panel: Medallion with a Sacrifice Scene between Two Victories Adorning Candelabra", 1759–95
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray and brown wash on white laid paper
markings:
Cooper Union Museum stamp on the verso
watermark: none
inscribed:
Inscribed on the recto in graphite along the upper margin: dessin original Prieur
Inscribed on the recto in pen and black ink along the lower margin: Purchased by Miss E G Hewitt
Inscribed in graphite along the lower right margin: 5
description: Design for a panel in which the central position is occupied by a large medallion with a scene of sacrifice.  On either side of the medallion, a figure of Victory adorns candelabra.  Composition is set against a dark background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Decorative Panel: Medallion with a Sacrifice Scene between Two Victories Adorning Candelabra", 1759–95.
1759–95. Pen and black ink, brush and gray and brown wash on white laid paper. Gift of Eleanor Garnier Hewitt. 1931-65-40.
